channel.title: Masterp00n's help thread
channel.description: Hi, I have seen problems with people that seem to need answers, so I made a help thread. Ask a question here and I will try my best to answer it.I'm doing this to try and get rep++ so ask away...cmon dont be shy and ask =]

item.title: Masterp00n's help thread
item.dc:creator: @dracar dracar
item.description:
@dracar wrote:

ok, u seem liek a good coder, and im sure at least a few of these are complicated… i jsut posed in my own thread but it seems like i am not going to get all the answers i need… so i post em here so u c em.

  1. How do you find like frames and stuff? i want to make my own special but i want the special bar on screen, i cant find the frame for the bottom of the screen…

  2. How do you work the jar command in command prompt? i am making a web client but i cant seem to get it to do it just right. so far i just got an empty jar file made…

  3. how do you make npcs agressive? i hate them just standing there its to easy. i want to use the sumoning code from cheezscape to make em folow the person for a second after they are attacked, that i can do im sure, but i dont know how to make them attack people

  4. got a glitch maybe, sometimes when a newer player, or a weaker player fights an npc, they cant walk away from it for a while.

  5. in wild the skull is only there when u start to move, for like .05 seconds. think its sumthin i did to wildy to fix it so it goes away when u leave but it didnt work…

  6. what frames i use to get text in diferent places on the screen? i made a global anounce command that shows the message but i dont know what the middle frame of the screen is, and i want to add my own specials to weapons, and add the bar to the screen in the bottom corner, but i can only find the top 2 spots, and i got them from a tut, u know were any other frames are?

hmm does this look at all liek it would make em agresive?

int isInNpcsArea = false

if (absX >= npcs[NPCID].absX-3 && absX <= npcs[NPCID].absX+3 && absY >= npcs[NPCID].absY-3 && absY <= npcs[NPCID].absY+3){
isInNpcArea = true;
}
if (isInNpcArea == true)
{
AttackPlayer(i);
}

Read full topic

item.title: Masterp00n's help thread
item.dc:creator: @masterp00n masterp00n
item.description:
@masterp00n wrote:

[quote=“jurm, post:132, topic:40649”][code]
case 24135: //Duel Mode On
{
inwildy = true;
sendMessage(“Duel Mode on, its like the wilderness anywhere!”);
sendMessage(“Remember, you can only attack others in the wild or that also have duel mode on!”);
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + " has activated duel mode! Hooray!";

outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(3); // command slot (does it matter which one?)
outStream.writeByteA(1); // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString(“Attack”);
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
break;
}
case 24134: // Duel Mode Off
{
inwildy = false;
sendMessage(“Duel Mode has been turned off…”);
sendMessage(“Phew, that was close, huh?”);
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + " has turned off duel mode. Boo!";
break;
}
[/code]

The idea was to make it so if the option was set to “On”, you could attack people in the wilderness from outside OR to attack other people with the setting to “On”. How would I make it so that 2 people with the option turned to “On” would be able to attack each other?[/quote]im not sure sorry[br][size=1]Posted on: January 30, 2007, 09:47:12 PM[/size][hr]anyone need more help

Read full topic

item.title: Masterp00n's help thread
item.dc:creator: @jurm jurm
item.description:
@jurm wrote:

case 24135: //Duel Mode On
{
inwildy = true;
sendMessage("Duel Mode on, its like the wilderness anywhere!");
sendMessage("Remember, you can only attack others in the wild or that also have duel mode on!");
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + " has activated duel mode! Hooray!";


outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(3);        // command slot (does it matter which one?)
outStream.writeByteA(1);        // 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("Attack");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
break;
}
case 24134: // Duel Mode Off
{
inwildy = false;
sendMessage("Duel Mode has been turned off...");
sendMessage("Phew, that was close, huh?");
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName + " has turned off duel mode. Boo!";
break;
}

The idea was to make it so if the option was set to “On”, you could attack people in the wilderness from outside OR to attack other people with the setting to “On”. How would I make it so that 2 people with the option turned to “On” would be able to attack each other?

Read full topic
